intro: Hieracium suberectum, commonly known as the upright hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with upright, hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped. Its flowers are yellow, with ray florets surrounding a central disk, and it produces small, oval seeds that are dispersed by wind. Hieracium suberectum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, where it thrives in full sun to partial shade.
